sen.j: 桃園天皇（ももぞのてんのう、寛保元年2月29日(1741年4月14日) - 宝暦12年7月12日（1762年8月31日））は、江戸時代の第116代天皇（在位：延享4年5月2日（1747年6月9日）- 宝暦12年7月12日（1762年8月31日））。
sen.e: Emperor Momozono (April 14th, 1741 - August 31st, 1762) was the hundred sixteenth Emperor during Edo period. (his reign was June 9th, 1747 - August 31st, 1762.)
Emperor Momozono (April 14th, 1741 - August 31st, 1762) was the hundred sixteenth Emperor during the Edo period. (his reign was from June 9th, 1747 to August 31st, 1762.)
Emperor Momozono (April 14, 1741 - August 31, 1762) was the hundred sixteenth Emperor during the Edo period. (his reign was from June 9, 1747 to August 31, 1762.)

sen.j: 幼名を八穂宮（やほのみや）または茶地宮（さちのみや）、諱を遐仁（とおひと）という。
sen.e: His name from childhood was Yaho no Miya or Sachi no Miya, his posthumous name was Tohito.
His name from childhood was Yaho no Miya or Sachi no Miya, his posthumous name was Tohito.
His name from childhood was Yaho no Miya or Sachi no Miya, his posthumous name was Tohito.

sen.j: 桜町天皇の第一皇子で、生母は権大納言姉小路実武の娘で桜町典侍の藤原定子（開明門院）。
sen.e: He was the first Prince of Emperor Sakuramachi, his birth mother was Gon Dainagon (Chief councilor of state), Sanetake Anegakoji's daughter, FUJIWARA no Sadako(Kaimeimon in) of Sakuramachi Naishi no suke.
sen.cmt: 権大納言→Gon Dainagon[大納言→a chief councillor of state]
sen.e: He was the first Prince of Emperor Sakuramachi, his birth mother was Gon Dainagon (Chief councilor of state), Sanetake Anegakoji's daughter, FUJIWARA no Sadako(Kaimeimon in) of Sakuramachi Naishi no suke.

He was the first Prince of Emperor Sakuramachi, his birth mother was Gon Dainagon (Chief councilor of state), Sanetake Anegakoji's daughter, FUJIWARA no Sadako (Kaimeimon in) of Sakuramachi Naishi no suke.

sen.j: 父の嫡妻、二条舎子（青綺門院）の「実子」としてその御所で育てられた。
sen.e: The Emperor was brought up as Ieko NIJO(Seikimon in) 's own child, his father's lawful wife, in her Palace.
The Emperor was brought up as Ieko NIJO(Seikimon in) 's own child, his father's lawful wife, in her Palace.
The Emperor was brought up as Ieko NIJO (Seikimon in) 's own child, his father's lawful wife, in her Palace.

tit.cmt: 他ファイルに合わせる

sen.j: 延享4年（1747年）立太子、同年、父桜町天皇の譲りを受けて即位。
sen.e: In 1747 he became Crown Prince and succeeded to the throne after his father, Emperor Sakuramachi passed the throne to him in the same year.
In 1747 he became Crown Prince and succeeded to the throne after his father, Emperor Sakuramachi passed the throne to him in the same year.
In 1747 he became Crown Prince and succeeded to the throne after his father, Emperor Sakuramachi passed the throne to him in the same year.

sen.j: 在位中の宝暦8年（1758年）に宝暦事件が発生し、朝廷内の尊王論者の若い公卿が幕府によって大量に処罰された。
sen.e: The Horei Incident happened in 1758 while his reign, many young Court nobles of the Imperial Palace who were imperialist, received punishment by the government.
The Horei Incident happened in 1758 during his reign, many young Court nobles of the Imperial Palace who were imperialist, were punishmed by the government.
The Horei Incident happened in 1758 during his reign, many young Court nobles of the Imperial Palace who were imperialist, were punished by the government.
He died when he was twenty two years old in 1762.
He died when he was twenty two years old in 1762.
He died when he was twenty two years old in 1762.
Enkyo (February 21, 1744) - July 12, 1748
Enkyo (February 21, 1744) - July 12, 1748

Kanen July 12, 1748 - October 27, 1751

Horyaku (Horeki) October 27, 1751 - (June 2, 1764)
Horyaku (Horeki) October 27, 1751 - (June 2, 1764)

sen.j: 京都市東山区今熊野泉山町の月輪陵（つきのわのみささぎ）に葬られた。
sen.e: The Emperor was entombed in Tsuki no Wa no Misasagi at Senzan-cho Town, Imagumano, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
The Emperor was entombed in Tsuki no Wa no Misasagi at Senzan-cho Town, Imagumano, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
